entry.title: Re: 1. Subsequent Implementation of a Further Accounting...
entry.content:
Hi @sbenfdil ,

Check below config, if its done correctly.

1. Check Currency Settings for the Ledger
Go to Transaction Code: FINSC_LEDGER. Check the ledger assigned to depreciation area 81CH. Ensure Group Currency (type 30) is configured for that ledger.

2. Maintain Parallel Currencies in Asset Accounting
Go to Transaction Code: OADB – Assign Currencies to Company Code. Verify that Group Currency (currency type 30) is listed. Then go to Transaction Code: OABC – Assign Currency Types to Depreciation Areas. Ensure depreciation area 81CH includes currency type 30. If missing, add the currency type with the correct position (e.g., second or third currency).

3. Check Chart of Depreciation and Area Settings
Transaction Code: AO90 or SPRO → Financial Accounting → Asset Accounting → Valuation → Areas → Define Depreciation Areas. Confirm that area 81CH is set to post to the general ledger and has correct posting rules. Make sure currency type 30 is enabled if the area needs to handle group currency postings.

4. Check Customizing for Ledger and Asset Integration
Go to SPRO → Financial Accounting → Asset Accounting → Integration with the General Ledger → Assign Depreciation Areas to Ledgers. Ensure depreciation area 81CH is correctly assigned to the relevant ledger where currency type 30 is active.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: Session Details not updated in FF Log
entry.content:
Hello @RaajMohan ,

1. Verify Workflow Event Linkage:
Run t-code SWEL, check if the FF workflow event triggers. Verify the workflow container and event linkage to ensure FF workflows are correctly attached.

2. GRACFF_CONFIG Table Settings
Check entries in table GRACFF_CONFIG for correct workflow event and workflow task assignments. Specifically, the setting for decentralized FF should have the proper workflow template and tasks assigned. Sometimes incorrect or missing entries here lead to workflow triggering failure.

3.Workflow Trace & Logs
Run SWI1 in ECC to check for workflow errors related to FF. Check SM58 for any failed RFC calls. Use ST22 to check for any dumps triggered during FF session or workflow processing.

4.FF Session Status & Workflow Status Sync
The WF cannot be determined status in GRAC_FFSESSION means the system could not find or trigger the expected workflow. Double-check if the workflow templates used are activated and not in error status. Run program GRAC_FF_MAINTAIN_WF_STATUSES to synchronize FF session workflow statuses.


Also take a look at SAP Note - 2710844 - Firefighter logs: workflow status “WF cannot be determined” after log collection.


If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: KE30 revenue not appear for customer
entry.content:
Hello @Senara ,

Try below steps.

1. Verify KE4I: Go to KE4I and confirm that your revenue condition types (e.g., PR00, or any custom ones used for ZDOM billings) are assigned to the relevant revenue value field (e.g., ERLOS) in your operating concern.

2. Check GL Account Master Data (FS00 or FSP0): Ensure the GL accounts posted for revenue from ZDOM billings are created as cost elements of category 11 or 12.

3. Check a Specific Billing Document: Find a ZDOM billing document for customer 2009577 and company code 1400.
-Display it in VF03.
-Go to Environment -> Account Assignment -> Profitability Analysis. This will show you the generated CO-PA document. Check if the revenue value field is populated there.
-If no CO-PA document exists, investigate VFX3 or the accounting document in FB03 for any errors preventing CO-PA update.

4. Analyze KE24: Run KE24 for customer 2009577 and billing type ZDOM. If data exists in KE24 but not KE30, the problem is with your KE30 report definition (form, selection, summarization).

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: Period Control Depreciation and Risk of IFRS Compliance
entry.content:
Hello @syamantaksaha ,

No, there isn't a specific "IFRS Compliant" version of SAP that forces compliance with all IFRS standards, including depreciation methods. SAP provides the functionality and tools to configure your system to be IFRS compliant, but it's ultimately the customer's responsibility to configure and use the system in an IFRS-compliant manner.

However, from IFRS compliance/feasibility standpoint,

1. Straight-Line Depreciation - Compliant
2. Useful Life-Based Allocation - Compliant
3. Component Accounting - Compliant (for asset components)
4. Multi-GAAP Reporting - Compliant (IFRS + Local GAAPs)
5. Real-Time Integration to Universal Journal (ACDOCA) - Supports full transparency and audit trail
6. Accounting Principles/Depreciation Areas - Allows separate ledgers for IFRS vs Local GAAP
7. IFRS 16 Lease Accounting (RE-FX or CLM-FX) - Compliant

In summary, SAP is an enabler for IFRS compliance, but it doesn't enforce it automatically. The responsibility lies with the implementing organization to ensure their configuration and usage align with IFRS principles.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: Delete Master Data Members Script
entry.content:
@Freddie 

Use the PlanningModel_1 to first first read all members where Delete property <> N or delete property=="". Finally delete the members provided you have no fact data sitting on those members.

Some rough scripting as below

var members_to_del = ArrayUtils.create(Type.string)

var allMembers = PlanningModel_1.getMembers("dimensionId");  // change dimension name

//filter members with delete property flag blank

for(var i=0;i<allMembers.length; i++)
{

if (allMembers[i].properties.DELETE==="")
{
members_to_del.push(allMembers[i].id)
}
}

//Delete the members

var deletestatus = PlanningModel_1.deleteMembers("dimensionId", members_to_del); // change dimensionid to your dimension

if(deletestatus)
{
Application.showMessage(ApplicationMessageType.Success,"Members Successfully Deleted");

}

API help here:

https://help.sap.com/doc/958d4c11261f42e992e8d01a4c0dde25/release/en-US/index.html#PlanningModel

Hope this helps !!

Nikhil

entry.title: IDC: Transforming Business Processes with AI-First Automation Platforms (Maureen Fleming)
entry.content:
Business process automation technology is rapidly advancing, growing beyond traditional flow and script based tools, embracing new AI based technologies. IDC analyzed these market trends for their recent report "IDC MarketScape: Worldwide Business Automation Platforms 2025 Vendor Assessment". We're excited to be able to share the thoughts of Maureen Fleming, one of the lead authors of the report, in this blog.

Guest author: Maureen Fleming, Program VP, Worldwide Intelligent Process Automation Market Research and Advisory Service

A fundamental transformation is taking place that enables organizations to expand, simplify, and lower the cost of business process improvement. The transformation involves the use of business automation platforms (BAPs) that aggregate and unify AI technologies – creating an AI-first approach to process improvement – that is coupled with diverse automation and automation planning technologies to automate and augment work. Today's BAPs feature four critical capabilities that distinguish them from earlier generations: natural language development, end-to-end orchestration, agentic automation, and continuous optimization.

Natural Language Development

Natural language development via text or voice interface enables business users and developers to converse with the AI assistant. For example, the copilot assistant interacts with the team working on the process design and auto-generates a business process modeling notation (BPMN) model that embeds into the low-code studio environment of the platform. The conversation picks up in the studio environment, with the copilot predicting next actions or the developer asking questions that generate the script required. Developers are able to move between low code and natural language development to complete the project. Business users are also able to become more involved with development through the conversational interface.

BAPs generate code across different planning tools and technology-specific automation environments that can be brought together to execute in production.

End-to-End Orchestration

End-to-end orchestration coordinates complex processes across multiple systems, applications, and automation technologies. These platforms seamlessly blend human tasks, AI agents, RPA bots, APIs, message brokers, and decision automation into a cohesive workflow. Among other things, this enables organizations to:

  • Gain better control of a transaction that spans multiple processes
  • Execute new types of digital services as value streams aimed at improving customer service
  • Become more proactive in operating and doing business, both executing a business process and supporting the remediation of problems when they occur

Agentic Automation

Agentic AI acts autonomously to achieve goals by making decisions and taking actions without constant human oversight. Unlike traditional AI that simply responds to prompts, agentic AI plans, reasons about problems, and executes multi-step workflows independently.

Agentic automation leverages a system of AI agents to execute work with minimal user input. In a BAP, AI agents leverage tools built with the collection of embedded automation technologies to execute actions recommended by the AI agent. This may involve the automation of simple tasks or the use of business rules to make decisions, ultimately leading to more sophisticated use cases that combine different tools with AI agents.

From a design perspective, AI agents are used to execute work that requires specialized knowledge traditionally performed manually by skilled workers, including forms and document processing and decision making. AI agents enable the shift from largely static processes to operate a more dynamic model.

The use of AI agents coupled with automation expands the types of tasks that can be automated. Leveraging an AI agent in combination with the deterministic technologies of a BAP significantly broadens the tasks and processes that can be fully automated while minimizing cost by combining non-deterministic generative AI with deterministic automation.

Continuous Optimization

The constant collection and processing of event logs coupled with machine learning algorithms and predictions can rapidly move enterprises into continuous improvement cycles. This approach fundamentally changes how organizations tactically approach process improvement. Instead of relying on quarterly reviews or annual assessments, businesses can now identify and address inefficiencies as they emerge, creating a dynamic environment where processes evolve and improve automatically.

Key to this evolution is the use of BAP vendor-supplied libraries of formulas and metrics associated with business value. These libraries can help teams justify investments in process improvement while using these same and additional metrics to proactively manage performance.

The Future of Business Automation

The future of business automation lies in the seamless integration of human intelligence and AI agents working together in orchestrated workflows. As natural language development capabilities mature and AI agents become more sophisticated, we can expect to see even more dramatic transformations in how organizations operate.

SAP remark: IDC recently published a comprehensive report on the subject, titled "IDC MarketScape: Worldwide Business Automation Platforms 2025 Vendor Assessment", recognizing SAP as a Leader in this space. Read an excerpt of the report including the SAP vendor profile here.

entry.title: Re: Price Comparison in "Determine Lowest Value – Market...
entry.content:
Please refer to the following SAP KBA - 

3335951 - App "Determine Lowest Value - Market Prices" not considering Purchase Order price

This issue is caused due to missing selection in the parameters.

Resolution

Before executing, make sure that the "Order Prices" checkbox is selected under the Price Comparison tab.

entry.title: Your Insights, Smarter AI, Real Impact – Join the SAP Customer Engagement Initiative 2025-2
entry.content:
Are you ready to unlock the full potential of AI and revolutionize your industry? With SAP’s cutting-edge AI technology, you can streamline operations, supercharge decision-making, and boost efficiency across your business like never before.

Now’s your opportunity to go beyond adoption — and become a driver of innovation. By joining our SAP Customer Engagement Initiative projects, you’ll play a direct role in shaping the next generation of AI solutions. Your feedback won’t just be heard — it will help design smarter tools tailored to your real-world challenges.

Don’t miss this opportunity to lead the way in digital transformation with AI.

🗓️ Be quick – registration closes on July 25, 2025!

  • AI Agent for Open Item Clearing
  • AI assisted creation of balance validation rules AND comment proposal
  • AI-assisted error resolution and data entry for SAP Fiori apps
  • AI-assisted Smart Visualization of MyHome for To-Dos (situations)
  • AI-powered chatbot (Joule) for Intelligent Margin Analysis
  • Automation and AI in SAP Discovery Center
  • Building BTP Solutions effectively with AI-augmented Infrastructure as Code Generation
  • Contingent & SOW Procurement in SAP Fieldglass: A Hands-on Experience with GenAI Features
  • Making your business future ready for Agentic AI - reimagining application development on BTP
  • Price Recommendation in S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition
  • Reimagine Warehouse Management with Joule
  • Sales Contract Management - Artificial Intelligent Handling for Quantity/Value Consumption by Joule
  • Shape the future of using AI in Cloud ALM for Operations
  • The Gen AI Assistant in SAP HANA Cloud
  • Tool-Agnostic Test Automation from AI-Generated Process Variants for ERP Systems

We believe that collaboration is key to unlocking innovation. By joining forces with our customers and partners, we can collectively shape the future of SAP’s products and change the way businesses operate using AI.

Seize this opportunity – register on influence.sap.com and be a part of the SAP Customer Engagement Initiative Cycle 2 in 2025! If you are also interested in other SAP Customer Engagement Initiative projects that are currently open for registration, check out the full list here.

Warm regards, 
Your SAP Customer Engagement Initiative Team 

Follow-up after registration: When you register for a project, you will be invited to an introductory call with the SAP project lead. At this point further participation is optional. Typically, all activities are governed by the Feedback Agreement with SAP.

entry.title: Create and Use an XML View
entry.content:
Business Scenario

In this exercise, you will create an XML view with a Hello World Text UI element. Then you delete the code that creates a Hello World Text UI element and places it on the HTML page in the module you created in the previous exercise. Instead, you will instantiate the XML view there and place it on the HTML page.

Template:Git Repository: https://github.com/SAP-samples/sapui5-development-learning-journey.git, Branch: sol/3_modules
Model solution:Git Repository: https://github.com/SAP-samples/sapui5-development-learning-journey.git, Branch: sol/4_views

I have done the same solution in BAS but it is showing below error. Could you please help on this.

 

1. Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 404 ()Understand this error
index.html:1

2. Refused to execute script from https://port8083-workspaces-ws-osfcd.us10.trial.applicationstudio.cloud.sap/resource/sap-ui-core.js because its MIME type ('text/html') is not executable, and strict MIME type checking is enabled.Understand this error
index.html?sap-client=100&sap-ui-xx-viewCache=false:27

3.Uncaught ReferenceError: sap is not defined
at index.html?sap-client=100&sap-ui-xx-viewCache=false:27:13
(anonymous) @ index.html?sap-client=100&sap-ui-xx-viewCache=false:27

entry.title: Re: Content Transport Using SAP Cloud Platform Transport Management Service in SAP CPI CF Environme
entry.content:
@Nikhil_Gursal 

Thanks a ton for your support. The above issue got resolved when I gave my SUSER ID and pwd. I am checking to create a technical user. Will update here for everyone. 

by the way, the URL mentioned above is right. Only care to be taken is - 

  1. Give the FULL ORG NAME with all the texts
  2. space to be replace by %20
  3. comma to be replaced by %2c
  4. use an SUSER in the TargetDestination in case the email doesn't work.

entry.title: Re: Upgrade Mobile Application Integration Framework (MAIF) using SAP Note Transport-based Correctio
entry.content:
Hi,

I tried several times to install the first TCI Note 3621000 for the upgrade of our S4FND component in our 2023 release. Everything looks good and then I get the following error.

Is this a known problem with note 3621000 and is someone working on that already?

entry.title: Re: Vendor Novation in SAP S/4HANA Public Sector Management
entry.content:
Meredith,

      Unfortunately, while I have not yet received an answer through this forum, I was able to find an answer using AI. I hope this helps!

Great question, Mark — and one that’s gaining traction as public sector organizations prepare for the SAP SRM sunset. Here's how best practice is shaping up for vendor novations in SAP S/4HANA Public Sector Management, especially when multi-year commitments and budget periods are involved:

🧾 Contract Novation Strategy

When Vendor A is acquired by Vendor B in FY24, and the original contract was created in FY23:

  • Amend the Original Contract: Update the vendor master data in the contract to reflect Vendor B. This preserves the contract number and historical linkage to FY23 commitments.
  • Use the “Old Contract Number” Field: In S/4HANA, this field helps trace the lineage of the contract from Vendor A to Vendor B, ensuring auditability and compliance.
  • Add Novation Texts: Include explanatory notes in the contract header (e.g., “Novation from Vendor A to Vendor B effective FY24”) to document the transition.

📦 Purchase Order Handling

For existing POs tied to the FY23 budget:

  • Close Original POs: Best practice is to close POs under Vendor A to prevent further processing.
  • Create New POs for Vendor B: Clone the original PO structure but assign Vendor B. Use the same contract reference and delivery dates to maintain continuity.
  • Preserve Budget Period: SAP allows new POs to inherit the original budget period (FY23) if the commitment was established then. This is supported by Multi-Year Budget Execution in Funds Management.

💰 Budget Integrity Across Fiscal Years

To ensure budget alignment:

  • Enable Delivery Date-Based Budgeting: Configure update profiles to track budget consumption by delivery date rather than posting date.
  • Use FM Derivation Rules: These can help ensure that the budget period from FY23 is retained even when the PO is recreated in FY24.
  • Avoid Budget Overruns: SAP will still check availability against FY23 limits, so ensure the new PO doesn’t exceed the original commitment.

🛠️ Tools & Configuration Tips

  • BidBuy Integration (for U.S. public sector): Some states use BidBuy to manage novation workflows, including cloning POs and updating vendor assignments while preserving obligation numbers.
  • SAP Notes & Attachments Tab: Use this to document the legal novation agreement and any internal approvals.

If you're working with Funds Management (FM) and Public Sector Management (PSM), this approach ensures compliance, traceability, and budget fidelity. Want to dive deeper into how FM derivation or update profiles are configured for this? I can walk you through it.

Solved: How to use Multiyear Budgeting - SAP Community

Solved: Budgeting for purchase order created for more than... - SAP Community

Solved: Budget check at PO level - SAP Community

Novation Assignment SAP v25.2

  • If so, which endpoint or integration method should be used?

Looking forward to your help.

entry.title: Changing Post Processing in DMEE
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I'm currently working on adapting DMEE format to align with the new ISO 20022 requirements, specifically for the CGI_XML_CT_V9 format. However, I'm encountering a blocking issue related to post processing of empty XML elements in the DMEE tree.

We are implementing the ISO pain 001.001.09 XML format, and during validation, the generated XML file fails.

I attempted to modify the Post Processing settings in the DMEE tree to adjust how empty elements are handled. The goal is to completely remove empty elements.

I followed these instructions: 3480644 - DMEE/DMEEX: XML Empty Element Processing

However, here's the issue:

  • I change the setting, save it, and activate the DMEE tree.

  • But every time I reopen the DMEE tree, the setting reverts back to “DO NOT REMOVE” – the change doesn't persist.

This means my XML output is still invalid, and I cannot move forward with the bank's required format.

Has anyone experienced this rollback issue in the DMEE post processing settings?

 Any guidance would be greatly appreciated. 

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Re: PIR Net price is not loading via Fiori Mass Changes
entry.content:
Probably, it would have been good had you shared the template where you maintained the value which is causing the issue. Now coming to your issue, not sure, whether you downloaded the template from the app itself or used any old template. If you have used any old template, try downloading the template from the app itself and test it.  Old templates might not work for many reasons.
As you might be knowing, SAP often expects the decimals with a dot and not comma. Hope, you have maintained the values with dot only. If you have maintained any currency symbol, remove that and upload, as this could be the root cause of the issue. Finally and most importantly, the excel stores the spaces and non-breaking spaces and ensure, you formatted such of those columns from Text to Columns to clean the field

entry.title: Re: Change Master Template for PO Print with Adobe Designer
entry.content:
Hello @Dylan2 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, each master page in Adobe Forms controls a specific layout. If you want your company name or legal text to appear across the PO.

  • Add the company name to each master page used (like Landscape, Portrait); otherwise, it won’t show on all pages.
  • For legal provisions that appear once, create a separate master page and use conditional display (only on the last page).

Editing one master page won’t affect the others. Each is used independently based on form logic.

Explaining Master Form Templates-SAP Learning 

Maintain Form Templates for Administrator-F1434/S34

Maintain Form Templates SAP Help

SAP Learning Hub-Maintaining Customer Content Form Templates 

Let me know if it was helpful

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Business Partner details from CAMT EBS statements not correctly filled for Returns
entry.content:
Question about payment returns in CAMT Electronic Bank Statements. 


Our problem is that Business Partner details from CAMT statements filled with our own data, not data for real Business Partner. The root cause is that in SAP Standard transformation FIEB_CAMT053_V8_TO_FEB for these fields for Credit transaction (CdtDbtInd = CRDT) are filled from Debtor fields (Section: NtryDtls/TxDtls/RltdAgts/DbtrAgt). For payments it works correct. But for returns, our banks sends us statements with CdtDbtInd = CRDT and Business Partner information in Creditor fields (Section: NtryDtls/TxDtls/RltdAgts/CdtrAgt). So, one of these two (either SAP or our Bank) treats it not right. I'm trying to understand who? Would be appreciated for your advices, about how correctly it should be filled (in Debtor or Creditor section)? Is there any guidance in CAMT format description for specific processes (like returns)?

entry.title: Re: The Complete Guide to Calling Actions in UI5 with Custom Code
entry.content:
Great blog @Marian_Zeis 

I recently came across multiple requirements were ideally actions could be useful, but in the end it was better to make it in a different way.  The main reason being how odd unbound actions are in RAP and limitations on abstract entities and their support for actions.

All those requirements were "too simple" that no fiori elements floorplan were a good fit. Just a classic input screen and a button to do something (move stock, post an accounting document etc).

I decided to create an abstract root entity with a single static/unbound action inside it with importing parameters. Inside the behavior pool the plan was to use EML to trigger MODIFY statements (such as CREATE or ACTION) on the standard business objects. This seems piece of cake but it's pretty much impossible (based on S/4HANA 2023).

My conclusion is RAP really lacks simplicity when you don't have a database table. In other words, it becomes simpler if you just create a table even when you do not need it. There should be a fiori elements floorplan to something similar to a executable program in ABAP where you don't have an output (or if your output is not a table).

I'd like to share in summary what I've done in 2 of such requirements

In one requirement I had to call a BAPI that would move stock between different locations based on a selection screen. I created a freestyle app that triggers a CREATE (POST) request just to take data on the selection screen and save on a (new) custom table. I used a managed key to generate the ID on each new entry. The freestyle app would then call an action for that new entry right away by passing that key (bound action). So there are 2 roundtrips. To add insult to injury, it was not possible to call the BAPI inside the behavior pool directly due to illegal statements in the behavior pool (by far one of the most annoying things in RAP). So the action basically calls the a FM in a separate task to move stock. To be honest I don't even remember why I decided to use OData V2 instead of V4 but there was some good reason.

The second requirement was actually very similar to the first one except that the input screen had a nested structure (deep entity in gateway terms). In the end I created a freestyle app now using OData V4 and initially I was doing 2 roundtrips as well. Then it became clear that it was possible to place everything on the same CREATE (POST) call. Still, it was very challenging to call the actions in OData V4 even knowing the 'execute' and 'invoke' methods. The way the action response was handled by SAPUI5 was very different depending if the action returned a $self of an abstract entity. The most important takeaway of that was that a "Context" in SAPUI5 does not always represent "a row" in the database but it can also be an abstraction of an action. Interesting in one hand, very confusing on the other. Forcing everything to be based on Contexts make the OData V4 ODataModel in UI5 very hard to use and way more complex than what it used to be in V2.

In other words I was almost forced to create database tables to fulfill both requirements. Those tables were not needed but at least they serve as "logs" that records each and every execution (together with its parameters and response). Still, compared to the effort if I'd create a SEGW project for each requirement, it would be way more simpler. SEGW and DPC classes gives you freedom that it's everything you need on something "too simple". Sorry saying that for any RAP fans out there.

Both apps were created in Typescript and I do not regret doing it.

entry.title: Re: SAP需求驱动的补货（DDMRP）
entry.content:
您好，这里有几个问题想请教：

值（ABC）分类的域值：对于已定义的一定时间段内，物料消耗与工厂所有物料消耗的比例值。比值高为A，比值低为C。-----物料消耗的数量，考虑哪些移动类型的消耗？ 物料消耗的金额=消耗数量*单价，这个单价指的是哪个价格？

可变性（XYZ）分类的域值：对物料消耗的变动性进行分类，变动性高为Z，变动性低为X。---XYZ的计算公式是什么呢？

物料清单的用途（PQR）分类的域值：根据物料作为BOM组件的次数来对物料进行分类。P为最高，R为最低。--这个计算公式是什么呢

entry.title: Unable to Reconcile USD Payment with USD Invoice If Customer is All Currency
entry.content:
Hello,

We are using SAP Business One with local currency set to EGP (Egyptian Pound).
We have a customer defined as "All Currencies".

Scenario:

- In February, we received an incoming payment in USD from the customer to a USD bank account, using an exchange rate of 60

- In June, we issued a USD invoice to the same customer, but at an exchange rate of 50.

- When trying to clear the invoice using the earlier payment (through Incoming Payments or manual reconciliation), we are facing the following issues

- The Cumulative Balance in FC (USD) is not equal to the Balance Due FC.

- The system only allows clearing in local currency (EGP) — it does not allow us to choose USD as the clearing currency.

- No option appears to settle in the original transaction currency (USD).

Question:

- Is there a way to force or allow clearing in foreign currency (USD) instead of local currency?

- How can we reconcile or match USD payments against USD invoices with different exchange rates?

- Is there a recommended workaround for this scenario 

Any insights would be highly appreciated.

Thanks

entry.title: Redis on SAP BTP: How it can support the Clean Core approach
entry.content:
In the evolving landscape of enterprise application development, SAP’s Clean Core approach enables customers building scalable, maintainable, and future-proof solutions. It emphasizes keeping the SAP S/4HANA core system clean of custom code and extensions, providing the guidance and the path for pushing such customizations to the Business Technology Platform (BTP). In this context, Redis on SAP BTP emerges as a powerful enabler for Clean Core adherence — enhancing performance, backend protection, and helping reduce total cost of ownership (TCO).

This post explores how Redis on SAP BTP, an in-memory cache service known for its speed and versatility, complements the Clean Core principles on SAP BTP.

Understanding the Clean Core Principles

The Clean Core philosophy promotes:

  • Minimizing custom code in the SAP core (S/4HANA).
  • Leveraging SAP BTP for extensions, side-by-side applications, and innovations.
  • Ensuring upgrade compatibility and operational stability.

To achieve this, enterprises must offload processing and data handling away from the core. Redis, as a cloud-native service on SAP BTP, can help in achieving this separation effectively.

Redis: A Clean Core ally

Redis on SAP BTP can serve as a central caching and transient data layer, which is essential for modern SAP extensions. Here’s how it can support the Clean Core approach:

1. Performance Acceleration with Caching

SAP backend systems can be burdened with frequent reads for non-critical data such as configuration, product lists, or metadata. Offloading these to Redis allows:

  • Millisecond response times.
  • Reduced pressure on core resources.
  • Improved user experience in frontend apps (Fiori) or custom BTP services.

Example: Use Redis to cache product availability data in an e-commerce extension instead of querying the S/4HANA system repeatedly.

2. Backend Protection with Rate Limiting and Queuing

Redis supports structures like token buckets and queues, which can protect backend systems from unexpected load surges:

  • Implement dynamic rate limiting to throttle requests to SAP S/4HANA APIs.
  • Use Redis streams or lists as buffer queues for processing backend-intensive operations asynchronously.

Example: Protect an order management system by queueing bulk order uploads in Redis, then processing them in controlled batches, for simple scenarios,  for more complex and critical scenarios please check SAP BTP Event Mesh.

3. Transient Data Handling for Microservices

Typically Clean Core-aligned applications are stateless microservices running on SAP BTP. Redis can act as a session store, short-lived cache, or inter-process communication layer, enabling smooth service orchestration without bloating the SAP core.

Example: Use Redis to temporarily store workflow state transitions in a BPM-like extension until they’re finalized and written back to SAP.

4. Supporting Clean Core with lower TCO

Running Redis on SAP BTP helps to ensure:

  • Managed service with autoscaling, reducing infrastructure overhead.
  • Serverless and cost-efficient usage patterns, especially for caching-heavy use cases.
  • Separation of concerns: offloading computation and storage to Redis reduces costs for high-throughput backend operations.

By smartly caching and decoupling operations, organizations can reduce the number of backend calls, ultimately lowering SAP API consumption costs and database load.

Conclusion

Redis on SAP BTP is more than a high-speed cache service —  can be a enabler component for implementing Clean Core-aligned architectures. It boosts performance,  protects backend systems from overload, supports stateless application design, and lowers TCO.
